It’s nice, but nothing truly groundbreaking. The game has been in Early Access for one and a half years, and unfortunately new content has been rather scarce. A lot has been announced, but little has actually been implemented. I wouldn’t buy it again at this point—let’s see how things develop.

The game is fun (when it gets updated) But right now it is simply updated too slow for it to be fun in the long term RIGHT NOW. Do not buy it yet, I would buy it shortly after it fully releases or gets close to that point.

This game has an amazing concept, amazing graphics and amazing gameplay.. Until you play for more then 10 hours  and realize how bare bones of an experience it actually is, especially for its price tag. The game is riddled with unavoidable game breaking bugs, broken mechanics and mediocre performance. It gets very few major updates and the updates that do come out are broken bug filled messes that go long swathes of time before being patched, The graphics themselves face constant clipping and janky animations all while the performance has been degraded to a severe degree since the game launched, the combat is good during the larger battles but the city building itself is awfully buggy and unstable, not to mention that the mechanics that are in place are quite bare. The game is not worth 40 euros and with the developers working at the speed of mojang at its worst its safe to say it wont be any time soon.  in short: amazing concept, lazy or just very untalented developer who stopped caring after cashing out on the inital sales, bug filled mess thats not getting fixed any time soon (that costs as much and more then far better games)
15% productivity at my saw mill because the AI pathing is just walking back and forth XD GG, will come back to test it again later maybe.

This game is fantastic... when it isn't broken due to the workers not collecting timber even though I have three unassigned families, 50 surplus timber, and 3 idling oxen. Happens every game I start after 5 minutes or 2 hours. Very disappointed that this bug has been around since the game was released and it is still not fixed. 

Aside from the bug, 4/5 stars. Here is why: The game is very fun. I love city builders and this one has great graphics, it is easy to control, and has lots of features. I can't wait to see what becomes of it. I would give it a fifth star (ignoring the game-breaking bug) if enemy ai would build on the other lands.

Really good concept, really bad execution. For the first year of the beta, things went fine, the game was unstable and you could only reach "mid game" or not even that, but we could see progress in the development. I feel like ever since Greg started to work in a team and not as a solo dev, things got worse.
I get that you have to organize your spaghetti code in order to work with a team and it takes time and effort, but this latest update is criminal. It made the overall state of the game feel like even more of a beta game than before, and didnt really solve any issues or moved the game forward. The only reason they released the update was because they left the community in the dark for months and wanted them to shut up. I have not given up on this game yet, but the lack of communication and current state of the game makes me worry if this game would ever be finished.

16 hours I understand this game is early access but it seems broken and unplayable without cheating or modding. It isn't balanced well enough to support growth and the trade mechanics are punishing. They also have features you work towards just to find out you strived hours to reach an access like plowing fields only to find they're broken and don't work well so you waste all those hours just to get a botched upgrade. I really wanted to like this game but to me it feels like they launched a game in early access in an entirely broken unbalanced state.
game crashes. system requirements are bullshit. 8g of graphics not enough.

The game itself is visually striking and there are some good bones there, but overall it's painfully incomplete. Resource management after the first few years is wildly unbalanced and combat feels bolted on from another game. It gets boring and repetitive quickly. Large sections of the game don't make a lot of sense, and nothing is well documented or explained. This one needs quite a bit more baking before its ready for serving. As it stands now, it's a frustrating experience that's one notch above vaporware.
Really fun game, like it a lot. Combat is janky and I've lost 10 hour between two save files that deleted themselves so can't post a positive review but has real potential.

I’ve been waiting for and supporting this game ever since the very first teaser dropped, and I bought it as soon as it became available. But up to now, it’s still just an unfinished product.

The map is small, lacking terrain variety, and almost doesn’t affect gameplay at all. The hilly and mountainous areas barely have any mineral deposits. Rivers don’t provide any fish or seafood. And there’s absolutely no point in building on higher ground for defense, since the combat system is still incomplete. Obviously, with the current map size, all I can build is a tiny little village—nowhere close to anything resembling a real city.

The professions and activities are mediocre, with little to no interaction with the environment or other systems. I mean, you build a hunter’s hut, and they just wander off to get meat on their own—you don’t even have to assign them an area. Same with gatherers; they don’t need any input from me. Oh, and since the map is pathetically lacking in resources, I don’t even have to bother deciding where to send them—because there isn’t anywhere else to gather from anyway.

The building system has nothing new compared to other games—nothing special in terms of quantity or mechanics. Honestly, when it comes to how buildings interact with each other, this game is miles behind FF (if you know what I’m talking about—the one where you need saw blades to run windmills, and you can only get those from traders or a foundry). The main building, castle, or whatever you want to call it has stayed just as barebones as ever.

Weather doesn’t matter at all. I left food sitting outside for an entire season, and it never spoiled. Hello? I need spoilage, drought, pests ruining crops, floods, or some kind of natural disaster—something to justify how long the devs have been delaying this game.

Please. With its graphics and potential, this game deserves so much more. For the price we paid, the devs owe us better. As it stands, it’s just plain disappointing.
